question: 限る
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>limit</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to limit</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: <vocabulary>to limit</vocabulary> things, you have something called a <reading>ca</reading>r (<ja>か</ja>) <reading>guillotine</reading> (<ja>ぎ</ja>) which you drive around limiting everything with.
